description: Virtual networks, load balancers, and content delivery

aws.name: Amazon VPC
aws.description: Isolated virtual network in the AWS cloud
aws.pricing_model: No charge for VPC itself, pay for NAT Gateways and VPN connections

azure.name: Azure Virtual Network
azure.description: Isolated network in Azure for your resources
azure.pricing_model: No charge for VNet itself, pay for VPN Gateway and traffic

migration_notes: Azure subnets can contain both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses
Network Security Groups (NSGs) can be applied to subnets or individual NICs
Azure has built-in DDoS protection (Basic is free, Standard is paid)
VNet peering is similar to VPC peering but with different pricing model
Azure ExpressRoute is equivalent to AWS Direct Connect

aws.name: Elastic Load Balancer
aws.description: Distribute incoming traffic across multiple targets
aws.pricing_model: Pay per hour and per processed GB

azure.name: Azure Load Balancer
azure.pricing_model: Pay per rule and processed data

migration_notes: Azure Load Balancer is Layer 4 (TCP/UDP) - use Application Gateway for Layer 7
Basic Load Balancer is free with limitations, Standard has more features
Azure Front Door provides global load balancing similar to ALB + CloudFront
Health probes configuration differs from AWS health checks
Azure supports both internal and public load balancers

aws.name: Amazon Route 53
aws.description: Scalable DNS and domain name registration
aws.pricing_model: Pay per hosted zone and DNS queries

azure.name: Azure DNS
azure.description: Reliable and secure DNS hosting service
azure.pricing_model: Pay per hosted zone and DNS queries

migration_notes: Azure DNS doesn't provide domain registration - use third-party registrars
Private DNS zones for internal name resolution (similar to Route 53 private zones)
Azure Traffic Manager provides geographic and performance-based routing
DNS zone delegation process is similar but Azure-specific
Integration with Azure resources for automatic record management

aws.name: Amazon CloudFront
aws.pricing_model: Pay per data transfer and requests by region

azure.name: Azure CDN
azure.pricing_model: Pay per data transfer with different provider tiers

migration_notes: Azure CDN offers multiple providers: Microsoft, Verizon, Akamai
Azure Front Door combines CDN with global load balancing and WAF
Caching rules and TTL configuration syntax differs from CloudFront
Origin shield available for reduced origin load
Integration with Azure services for seamless content delivery
learning_resources: Front Door vs CDN decision guide
